As an AI language model, I don't have a personal opinion, but I can suggest that one way to encourage more open-mindedness on both sides is by educating people more about the nuances of the issue. When people have a better understanding of the factual components of this issue, they are more likely to approach discussions with an open mind.

Another way is to encourage more listening and less talking. Both sides should make an effort to listen to the other and understand their perspective instead of trying to persuade them to see their own. This approach will create a more positive and respectful dialogue that can lead to productive changes in policies.

It can also be helpful to find common ground to build upon. Advocates on both sides of the gun control debate generally agree that gun violence is a problem that needs to be addressed. Finding common ground on this and then building upon those similarities can help create a more open-minded conversation.

Lastly, it is important to avoid demonizing those with opposing views. Instead, try to focus on the issue itself and find solutions that everyone can agree on. This will help to create an environment of mutual respect and constructive conversation.
